contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox japan station |namerom = JR Namba |name = JR難波 |image = JR-Nanba.jpg |imagesize = |caption = Underground platform |pref = Osaka|city = Osaka|ward = Naniwa|address = 4-1, Minatomachi Itchome |jaloc = 大阪市浪速区湊町一丁目4-1 |postal = |coordinates = {{Coord|34|39|59.1|N|135|29|43.2|E|region:JP_type:railwaystation|display=inline,title}} |open = 1889 |oldname = Minatomachi |presentname = 1994 |operator = [[JR West]] |line = [[Kansai Main Line]]<br />([[Yamatoji Line]]) |stats = |statsnote = |bus = t4 }} [[Image:JR Namba.jpg|thumb|OCAT building above the station]] [[Image:JR-Nanba2.jpg|thumb|Ticket gate]] {{Nihongo|'''JR Namba Station'''|JR難波駅|Jeiāru-Nanba-eki}} is a [[railway station]] in [[Namba]], [[Naniwa Ward]], [[Osaka]], [[Japan]], adjacent to [[Namba Station]] ([[Nankai Railway]], [[Osaka Subway]]) and [[Osaka Namba Station]] ([[Kintetsu]], [[Hanshin Railway]]) operated by the [[West Japan Railway Company]]. JR Namba is the western terminus of the [[Kansai Main Line]] ([[Yamatoji Line]]). == History == The [[Osaka Railway]] opened {{nihongo|Minatomachi Station|湊町駅}} as its terminal in Osaka on March 1, 1899. The railway was succeeded by the [[Kansai Railway]] in 1900 and was [[Railway Nationalization Act|nationalized]] in 1907. The station was renamed JR Namba on September 4, 1994, the day [[Kansai International Airport]] opened. New underground facilities opened on March 22, 1996 and replaced the former above-ground station.<ref>{{Teishajo|II|p. 344}}</ref> == Layout == There are 2 [[island platform]]s with four tracks underground. {{Ja-rail-line|pwidth=80px|pfn=1, 2, 3, 4|first=4|linename=Yamatoji Line|dir=for {{Ja-stalink|Tennoji}}, {{Ja-stalink|Oji||Nara}}, {{Ja-stalink|Nara}}, {{Ja-stalink|Kamo||Kyoto}} and {{Ja-stalink|Takada||Nara}}|col=#093}} == Surroundings == * [[Osaka City Air Terminal]] (OCAT) * Minatomachi River Place ** [[FM Osaka]] * [[Sankei Shimbun]] Osaka Head Office === Bus stops === ;Osaka City Air Terminal (OCAT) {{See|Osaka City Air Terminal#Bus terminal}} ;JR Namba ekimae ([[Osaka Municipal Transportation Bureau]]) * Sennichimae-dori (westbound) ** Route 29 for {{Ja-stalink|Suminoekoen|Subway Suminoekoen}} via {{Ja-stalink|Ashiharabashi|Ashiharabashi-ekimae}} ** Route 52 for {{Ja-stalink|Osaka Abenobashi|Abenobashi}} via Nagahashi Nichome ** Route 60 for Tempozan via {{Ja-stalink|Sakuragawa|Subway Sakuragawa|Osaka}} ** Route 71 for Tsurumachi Yonchome via Taishobashi and Taisho-kuyakusho-mae ** Route 75 for {{Ja-stalink|Ōsaka|Ōsaka ekimae (Ōsaka Station)}} via Naniwa-suji ** Route 108 for Tsurumachi Yonchome via Taishobashi and Chitosebashi * Sennichimae-dori (eastbound) ** Routes 29, 52, 75, 71 and 108 for {{Ja-stalink|Namba}} ** Route 60 for Namba ([[Takashimaya]]) * Yotsubashi-suji (northbound) ** Route 84 for {{Ja-stalink|Bentencho|Bentencho Bus Terminal}} ** Route 85 for {{Ja-stalink|Tōbu-shijō-mae|Kumata}} via {{Ja-stalink|Tamatsukuri}} ** Routes 103 for Ōsaka ekimae (Ōsaka Station) via Yotsubashi-suji == Adjacent stations == {{J-railservice start}} {{J-route|route=Yamatoji Line|col=#093|f=w}}
